metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5119 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use of an uninitialized value in Skia in Google Chrome prior to61.0.3163.79 for Mac, Windows, and Linux, and 61.0.3163.81 for Android,allowed a remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information fromprocess memory via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-browser-l10n - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-chromedriver - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1306').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
